item.title: Graffiti on utility box and steet furniture, 26th October
item.description:
Because the graffiti on the utility box and the fence at this location that I reported some weeks ago has not been removed, it is getting worse and it has now spread to the street furniture (lamppost, see photo).

item.title: Volunteer litter pick bags ready for collection, 25th October
item.description:
Litter pick bags ready for collection. Two bags, one containing general litter and the other cans/plastic bottles for recycling. Lay-by on the A40 between Wheatstone Inn and Liddington Road (before you go under the railway bridge) next to the litter bin. The 'What 3 Words' location is herb.closer.salad The ordnance survey map reference is: 51.87699, -2.197851 Council Litter Bin Ref: 0304

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Litter picking bags ready for collection

item.title: Large pothole on Warden Hill Road towards centre line, 25th October
item.description:
What3words is next.bats.often Large pothole that requires vehicles to swerve close to the other side of the road or very close to the kerb to avoid damaging vehicles wheels. Have noticed this pothole for around 2 weeks and is getting bigger each day, potential of risk of injury to pedestrians that may cross due to this being a school area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 79, Warden Hill Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Debris from a camper near Hatherley Brook, 25th October
item.description:
There is a pile of rubbish that has been left by someone camping under the trees and next to the brook along Merestones Road before it changes into Sir Charles Irving Close. Locals suspect there may be drugs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19-22, Sir Charles Irving Close, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing public bin, 25th October
item.description:
Bin hasn't been emptied since installed. Overflowing with bagged dog waste and now a health hazard
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goldsmith Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are several blocked drains on Sandy Lane (deeply caked up, not just superficial blockage of grille), so not functioning as drains at all. There is also a drain on the mini roundabout at junction with Greenhills Rd that was fully silted up (I dug a lot of it out at dawn today but as traffic became active it wasnâ€™t safe to continue). In heavy rain the blocked drain on the roundabout causes local flooding on the roundabout and the blocked drains on Sandy Lane mean that water has to flow in larger volume, veering into Withyholt Park which overwhelms the drains and threatens partial flooding of the properties. Please could you send a team to dig out these drains (safely) so that they can function as drains again. Many thanks in advance., 25th October
item.description:
Several drains on Sandy Lane towards the Greenhills Rd end and a drain on the mini roundabout at the junction of these roads

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Sandy Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The side of the road as loose paving, 25th October
item.description:
When two cars pass at this point one has to pull the passenger side on the the concrete verge. This verge ends abruptly with a drop. Part of the concrete verge has become dislodged and is a hazard to cars especially in the dark when it is unlikely to be seen
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aggs Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
